info.description: API for managing product requirements through hierarchical structure of Epics, User Stories, and Requirements
info.title: Product Requirements Management API

delete.description: Deletes acceptance criteria with comprehensive validation and cascading deletion

parameters.description: Acceptance Criteria ID (UUID or reference ID)
parameters.name: id

get.description: Validates if acceptance criteria can be deleted and returns dependency information
get.summary: Validate acceptance criteria deletion

parameters.description: Acceptance Criteria ID (UUID or reference ID)
parameters.name: id

get.description: Provides detailed information for user confirmation before deletion
get.summary: Get deletion confirmation

delete.description: Deletes an epic with comprehensive validation and cascading deletion

get.description: Validates if an epic can be deleted and returns dependency information
get.summary: Validate epic deletion

delete.description: Deletes a requirement with comprehensive validation and cascading deletion

get.description: Validates if a requirement can be deleted and returns dependency information
get.summary: Validate requirement deletion

get.description: Performs full-text search and filtering across epics, user stories, acceptance criteria, and requirements
get.summary: Search across all entities

parameters.description: Filter by creation date from (RFC3339 format)
parameters.name: created_from

parameters.description: Filter by creation date to (RFC3339 format)
parameters.name: created_to

parameters.description: Sort by field (priority, created_at, last_modified, title)
parameters.name: sort_by

get.description: Get search suggestions based on partial query
get.summary: Get search suggestions

delete.description: Deletes a user story with comprehensive validation and cascading deletion

parameters.description: User Story ID (UUID or reference ID)
parameters.name: id

get.description: Validates if a user story can be deleted and returns dependency information
get.summary: Validate user story deletion

parameters.description: User Story ID (UUID or reference ID)
parameters.name: id

get.description: Retrieve a list of acceptance criteria with optional filtering by user story and author. Supports pagination and custom ordering to help organize testable conditions across the system.
get.summary: List acceptance criteria with filtering and pagination

200.description: Successfully retrieved acceptance criteria list with count

get.description: Retrieve specific acceptance criteria by its UUID or human-readable reference ID (e.g., AC-001). Returns the acceptance criteria with all its properties including the testable condition and associated user story.
get.summary: Get acceptance criteria by ID or reference ID

parameters.description: Acceptance criteria UUID or reference ID
parameters.name: id

put.description: Update acceptance criteria properties including the testable condition text and description. Only provided fields will be updated, maintaining the relationship to the parent user story.

parameters.description: Acceptance criteria update request with optional fields
parameters.name: acceptance_criteria

400.description: Invalid acceptance criteria ID format or request body

delete.description: Delete acceptance criteria by its UUID. Deletion is prevented if the acceptance criteria has associated requirements or if it's the last acceptance criteria for a user story. Use force=true to override these constraints.

parameters.description: Force delete with dependencies and constraints
parameters.name: force

409.description: Acceptance criteria has associated requirements or is the last one for user story (use force=true)

get.description: Retrieve a list of epics with optional filtering by creator, assignee, status, and priority. Supports pagination and custom ordering.
get.summary: List epics with filtering and pagination

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Number of results to skip for pagination
parameters.name: offset

post.description: Create a new epic with the provided details. The epic will be assigned a unique reference ID (EP-XXX format) and default status of "Backlog".

400.description: Invalid request body, creator/assignee not found, or invalid priority

get.description: Retrieve a single epic by its UUID or reference ID (e.g., EP-001). Supports both formats for flexible access.
get.summary: Get an epic by ID or reference ID

put.description: Update an epic's properties. Only provided fields will be updated. Supports partial updates with validation for status transitions and priority values.

400.description: Invalid request body, epic ID format, assignee not found, invalid priority, invalid status, or invalid status transition

delete.description: Delete an epic by UUID. By default, epics with associated user stories cannot be deleted unless force=true is specified.

parameters.description: Force delete even if epic has user stories
parameters.name: force

409.description: Epic has associated user stories and cannot be deleted (use force=true to override)

patch.description: Assign an epic to a specific user by updating the assignee_id. The system validates that the assignee user exists before making the assignment.
patch.summary: Assign an epic to a user

400.description: Invalid epic ID format, request body, or assignee not found

patch.description: Update the workflow status of an epic. The system validates status transitions and ensures only valid status changes are allowed. All status transitions are currently permitted as per business requirements.
patch.summary: Change the status of an epic

400.description: Invalid epic ID format, request body, epic status, or status transition

get.description: Retrieve an epic along with all its associated user stories. This endpoint provides a hierarchical view of the epic and its child user stories, including their acceptance criteria and requirements if available.
get.summary: Get an epic with its user stories

200.description: Epic with user stories retrieved successfully

post.description: Create a new user story that belongs to the specified epic. This is a nested resource creation that establishes the parent-child relationship between epic and user story. The epic ID from the URL path will override any epic_id in the request body.
post.summary: Create a new user story within an epic

parameters.description: User story creation request (epic_id will be overridden by path parameter)
parameters.name: user_story

201.description: Successfully created user story within epic

400.description: Invalid epic ID format, request body, creator/assignee not found, epic not found, invalid priority, or invalid user story template

delete.description: Delete a specific relationship between requirements by its UUID. This removes the dependency or association between the two requirements.

get.description: Retrieve a list of requirements with optional filtering by user story, acceptance criteria, creator, assignee, status, priority, and type. Supports pagination and custom ordering.
get.summary: List requirements with filtering and pagination

200.description: Successfully retrieved requirements list with count

post.description: Create a new detailed requirement with specified properties. Requires a valid user story ID, creator, and requirement type. The assignee defaults to the creator if not specified.

parameters.description: Requirement creation request with all required fields
parameters.name: requirement

400.description: Invalid request body, creator/assignee not found, user story not found, requirement type not found, acceptance criteria not found, or invalid priority

post.description: Create a typed relationship between two requirements (e.g., depends_on, blocks, relates_to, conflicts_with, derives_from). Prevents circular relationships and duplicate relationships. Validates that both requirements and the relationship type exist.

parameters.description: Relationship creation request with source, target, type, and creator
parameters.name: relationship

400.description: Invalid request body, source/target requirement not found, relationship type not found, creator not found, or circular relationship detected

get.description: Perform full-text search across requirement titles and descriptions using PostgreSQL's text search capabilities. Returns requirements that match the search query with relevance ranking.
get.summary: Search requirements by text

200.description: Successfully retrieved search results with count and query

get.description: Retrieve a specific requirement by its UUID or human-readable reference ID (e.g., REQ-001). Returns the requirement with all its properties and relationships.
get.summary: Get a requirement by ID or reference ID

put.description: Update a requirement's properties including acceptance criteria, assignee, priority, status, type, title, and description. Only provided fields will be updated. Status transitions are validated according to business rules.

parameters.description: Requirement update request with optional fields
parameters.name: requirement

400.description: Invalid requirement ID format, request body, assignee not found, requirement type not found, acceptance criteria not found, invalid priority, invalid requirement status, or invalid status transition

delete.description: Delete a requirement by its UUID. By default, deletion is prevented if the requirement has associated relationships. Use force=true query parameter to delete with all dependencies.

409.description: Requirement has associated relationships and cannot be deleted (use force=true)

patch.description: Assign a requirement to a specific user by updating the assignee field. The assignee must be a valid user in the system.

400.description: Invalid requirement ID format, request body, or assignee not found

get.description: Retrieve all incoming and outgoing relationships for a specific requirement by its UUID or reference ID. Returns both relationships where the requirement is the source and where it is the target.
get.summary: Get all relationships for a requirement

200.description: Successfully retrieved relationships list with count

patch.description: Update the status of a requirement. Status transitions are validated according to business rules to ensure proper workflow progression (e.g., draft  in_review  approved  implemented  tested).

400.description: Invalid requirement ID format, request body, invalid requirement status, or invalid status transition

get.description: Retrieve a list of user stories with optional filtering by epic, creator, assignee, status, and priority. Supports pagination and custom sorting.
get.summary: List user stories with filtering and pagination

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Number of results to skip for pagination
parameters.name: offset

200.description: Successfully retrieved user stories list with count

post.description: Create a new user story with the provided details. The epic_id must be specified in the request body to establish the parent-child relationship. The user story description should follow the template format: 'As [role], I want [function], so that [goal]'.

400.description: Invalid request body, epic_id required, creator/assignee not found, epic not found, invalid priority, or invalid user story template

get.description: Retrieve a specific user story by its UUID or human-readable reference ID (e.g., US-001). Returns the user story with basic information excluding related entities.
get.summary: Get a user story by ID or reference ID

parameters.description: User story UUID or reference ID
parameters.name: id

put.description: Update an existing user story by its UUID. All fields in the request body are optional and will only update the provided fields. The user story description should follow the template format if provided.

400.description: Invalid user story ID format, request body, assignee not found, invalid priority, invalid status, invalid status transition, or invalid user story template

delete.description: Delete a user story by its UUID. By default, deletion will fail if the user story has associated requirements or acceptance criteria. Use the force=true query parameter to delete with all dependencies.

409.description: User story has associated requirements and cannot be deleted (use force=true)

get.description: Retrieve a specific user story by its UUID or reference ID, including all associated acceptance criteria. This endpoint provides hierarchical data showing the user story and its testable conditions.
get.summary: Get user story with acceptance criteria

parameters.description: User story UUID or reference ID
parameters.name: id

200.description: Successfully retrieved user story with acceptance criteria

post.description: Create new acceptance criteria that belongs to the specified user story. This is a nested resource creation that establishes the parent-child relationship between user story and acceptance criteria. The user story ID from the URL path will be used as the parent.
post.summary: Create acceptance criteria within a user story

parameters.description: Acceptance criteria creation request (user_story_id will be set from path parameter)
parameters.name: acceptance_criteria

201.description: Successfully created acceptance criteria within user story

400.description: Invalid user story ID format, request body, user story not found, or author not found

patch.description: Assign a user story to a specific user by updating the assignee_id. The assignee must be a valid user in the system.
patch.summary: Assign user story to a user

400.description: Invalid user story ID format, request body, or assignee not found

get.description: Retrieve a specific user story by its UUID or reference ID, including all associated detailed requirements. This endpoint provides hierarchical data showing the user story and its technical requirements.
get.summary: Get user story with requirements

parameters.description: User story UUID or reference ID
parameters.name: id

200.description: Successfully retrieved user story with requirements

post.description: Create a new detailed requirement that belongs to the specified user story. This is a nested resource creation that establishes the parent-child relationship between user story and requirement. The user story ID from the URL path will be used as the parent.
post.summary: Create a requirement within a user story

parameters.description: Requirement creation request (user_story_id will be set from path parameter)
parameters.name: requirement

201.description: Successfully created requirement within user story

400.description: Invalid user story ID format, request body, creator/assignee not found, user story not found, requirement type not found, acceptance criteria not found, or invalid priority

patch.description: Update the status of a user story. All status transitions are allowed by default. Valid statuses are: Backlog, Draft, In Progress, Done, Cancelled.

400.description: Invalid user story ID format, request body, invalid status, or invalid status transition

get.description: Retrieve all acceptance criteria created by a specific user. This endpoint helps track which testable conditions were authored by each team member.
get.summary: Get acceptance criteria by author

200.description: Successfully retrieved acceptance criteria list with count

product-requirements-management_internal.description: Testable conditions that define when a user story is considered complete and acceptable

author.description: User who authored this acceptance criteria

author_id.description: ID of the user who authored this acceptance criteria

comments.description: Comments associated with this acceptance criteria

created_at.description: Timestamp when the acceptance criteria was created

description.description: EARS format description of the acceptance criteria
description.example: WHEN a user enters valid credentials THEN the system SHALL authenticate the user and redirect to the dashboard

id.description: Unique identifier for the acceptance criteria

last_modified.description: Timestamp when the acceptance criteria was last modified

requirements.description: Requirements linked to this acceptance criteria

user_story_id.description: ID of the parent user story

product-requirements-management_internal.description: A comment that can be attached to any entity, supporting both general and inline comments with threading

author_id.description: ID of the user who authored this comment

content.example: This requirement needs clarification on the authentication flow.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the comment was created

entity_id.description: ID of the entity this comment is attached to

entity_type.description: Type of entity this comment is attached to

is_resolved.description: Whether this comment has been resolved

parent_comment_id.description: Optional ID of parent comment for threaded discussions

text_position_end.description: End position of linked text for inline comments

text_position_start.description: Start position of linked text for inline comments

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the comment was last updated

product-requirements-management_internal.description: Type of entity that can receive comments in the system

x-enum-comments.EntityTypeAcceptanceCriteria: Acceptance Criteria - testable conditions for user stories
x-enum-comments.EntityTypeUserStory: User Story - feature requirement within an epic

x-enum-descriptions: Epic - top-level feature container
User Story - feature requirement within an epic
Acceptance Criteria - testable conditions for user stories
Requirement - detailed technical requirement

product-requirements-management_internal.description: Epic is a large body of work that can be broken down into smaller user stories. It represents a significant feature or initiative that delivers business value.

assignee.description:
Assignee contains the user information of who is assigned to the epic
@Description User currently assigned to this epic (populated when requested with ?include=assignee)

comments.description:
Comments contains all comments associated with this epic
@Description List of comments on this epic (populated when requested with ?include=comments)

creator.description:
Creator contains the user information of who created the epic
@Description User who created this epic (populated when requested with ?include=creator)

user_stories.description:
UserStories contains all user stories that belong to this epic
@Description List of user stories that belong to this epic (populated when requested with ?include=user_stories)

product-requirements-management_internal.description: Status of an epic in the workflow lifecycle

x-enum-comments.EpicStatusBacklog: Epic is in the backlog - not yet started, awaiting prioritization
x-enum-comments.EpicStatusCancelled: Epic has been cancelled - will not be implemented
x-enum-comments.EpicStatusDone: Epic is completed - all user stories finished
x-enum-comments.EpicStatusDraft: Epic is in draft state - being defined and refined
x-enum-comments.EpicStatusInProgress: Epic is being actively worked on

x-enum-descriptions: Epic is in the backlog - not yet started, awaiting prioritization
Epic is in draft state - being defined and refined
Epic is being actively worked on
Epic is completed - all user stories finished
Epic has been cancelled - will not be implemented

x-enum-comments.PriorityCritical: Critical priority - highest urgency, immediate attention required
x-enum-comments.PriorityHigh: High priority - important, should be addressed soon
x-enum-comments.PriorityLow: Low priority - nice to have, can be deferred
x-enum-comments.PriorityMedium: Medium priority - normal importance, standard timeline

x-enum-descriptions: Critical priority - highest urgency, immediate attention required
High priority - important, should be addressed soon
Medium priority - normal importance, standard timeline
Low priority - nice to have, can be deferred

product-requirements-management_internal.description: A detailed requirement that specifies what needs to be implemented within a user story

acceptance_criteria_id.description: Optional ID of linked acceptance criteria

assignee.description: User assigned to implement this requirement

assignee_id.description: ID of the user assigned to implement the requirement

created_at.description: Timestamp when the requirement was created

creator_id.description: ID of the user who created the requirement

description.example: The system shall support OAuth 2.0 authentication flow with support for Google, GitHub, and Microsoft providers. The implementation must handle token refresh and provide secure session management.

last_modified.description: Timestamp when the requirement was last modified

source_relationships.description: Relationships where this requirement is the source

target_relationships.description: Relationships where this requirement is the target

type_id.description: ID of the requirement type (Functional, Non-Functional, etc.)

user_story_id.description: ID of the parent user story

product-requirements-management_internal.description: Status of a requirement in the workflow lifecycle

x-enum-comments.RequirementStatusActive: Active - requirement is approved and being implemented
x-enum-comments.RequirementStatusDraft: Draft - requirement is being written and refined
x-enum-comments.RequirementStatusObsolete: Obsolete - requirement is no longer needed or has been superseded

x-enum-descriptions: Draft - requirement is being written and refined
Active - requirement is approved and being implemented
Obsolete - requirement is no longer needed or has been superseded

product-requirements-management_internal.description: A user account in the system with authentication and role-based permissions

created_at.description: Timestamp when the user account was created

email.description: Unique email address for login and notifications

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the user account was last updated

product-requirements-management_internal.description: Role that determines user permissions and access levels in the system

x-enum-comments.RoleAdministrator: Administrator - full system access including user and configuration management
x-enum-comments.RoleCommenter: Commenter - can only add comments, limited editing capabilities
x-enum-comments.RoleUser: User - can create, edit, and delete entities

x-enum-descriptions: Administrator - full system access including user and configuration management
User - can create, edit, and delete entities
Commenter - can only add comments, limited editing capabilities

product-requirements-management_internal.description: User story is a short, simple description of a feature told from the perspective of the person who desires the new capability. It belongs to an epic and can have multiple acceptance criteria and requirements.

acceptance_criteria.description:
AcceptanceCriteria contains all acceptance criteria that belong to this user story
@Description List of acceptance criteria that define when this user story is considered complete (populated when requested with ?include=acceptance_criteria)

assignee.description:
Assignee contains the user information of who is assigned to the user story
@Description User currently assigned to this user story (populated when requested with ?include=assignee)

comments.description:
Comments contains all comments associated with this user story
@Description List of comments on this user story (populated when requested with ?include=comments)

creator.description:
Creator contains the user information of who created the user story
@Description User who created this user story (populated when requested with ?include=creator)

requirements.description:
Requirements contains all requirements that belong to this user story
@Description List of detailed requirements that belong to this user story (populated when requested with ?include=requirements)

product-requirements-management_internal.description: Status of a user story in the workflow lifecycle

x-enum-comments.UserStoryStatusBacklog: User story is in the backlog - not yet started, awaiting prioritization
x-enum-comments.UserStoryStatusCancelled: User story has been cancelled and will not be implemented
x-enum-comments.UserStoryStatusDone: User story has been completed and meets acceptance criteria
x-enum-comments.UserStoryStatusDraft: User story is being drafted - requirements are being defined
x-enum-comments.UserStoryStatusInProgress: User story is actively being worked on

x-enum-descriptions: User story is in the backlog - not yet started, awaiting prioritization
User story is being drafted - requirements are being defined
User story is actively being worked on
User story has been completed and meets acceptance criteria
User story has been cancelled and will not be implemented
